tests.name: Python syntax validation
tests.details: All backend Python files compile cleanly: auth.py (with DEV_USER and auth_mode check), config.py (with auth_mode field_validator), main.py (with auth mode logging).

tests.name: Backend auth_mode config validation
tests.details: Settings.auth_mode field_validator correctly normalizes 'sso'/'dev' to lowercase and rejects invalid values. Default is 'sso'.

tests.name: Dev user consistency check
tests.details: Frontend DEV_USER_PROFILE.sysId ('dev-000000000000000000000000000000') matches backend DEV_USER.sys_id ('dev-000000000000000000000000000000'). Roles match: ['admin', 'itil'].

tests.name: Middleware dev mode bypass
tests.details: When AUTH_MODE=dev, middleware returns NextResponse.next() immediately without checking session cookies. When AUTH_MODE=sso, existing cookie check and redirect logic is preserved.

tests.name: SSO code path regression check
tests.details: All existing SSO code paths are unchanged: ServiceNow OAuth provider config, JWT callback (non-dev branch), session callback, token validation in backend auth.py (non-dev branch), and api.ts Bearer token attachment (non-dev branch).

tests.name: Zero-mock compliance
tests.details: Scanned all 12 changed files. DEV_USER/DEV_USER_PROFILE are legitimate dev-mode bypass constants gated behind AUTH_MODE=dev, not mock data. No placeholder functions, stub implementations, or hardcoded secrets detected.
